ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my ability to render objects via acrylic and I gained a greater understanding of color and space and how they work to form aesthetically pleasing works of art.
I learned how to incorporate and challenge my visual thinking.
First-time ever painter. This class was a lot of fun, and I learned a lot about painting. I will definitely continue my painting career after this course
I learned some of the basics of painting.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course should eliminate the materials fee. The value of the items received for "free" certainly did not amount to $75 and it's honestly a deterrent for many students interested in the course.
I think we could do more independent work, or we could paint each other as an assignment!
The course is largely unstructured, which is both a good and a bad thing.
Maybe some more specific technique instruction. It's very "learn by doing", just really going at it with making paintings, which is good but maybe could be just a little more technical.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. The class time is longer than most 1-credit courses but I feel I learned a lot over the progression of the year both about acrylic and myself as an admirer of art.
If Mark was teaching it, no. If another teacher, yes.

Definitely take it if you can!!!! you do need to have some rudimentary skills to get in bc it is popular. materials can also be pricey. I'm so so glad I got to take an art class here. I hope they offer more sections of painting basics in future. as opposed to intro painting, it is truly geared towards beginners. I found it really engaging and learned a lot about the way my brain sees things in space. it was a great outlet to be able to really focus in on something for a few hours every week.

Definitely take the class if you get in! The workload was super nice - you're just painting in class and you don't even have homework. You finish off the semester with a batch of awesome work! The only thing was that Mark didn't really give us as much feedback as I expected, but at the same time it let us really just do our own thing, which was nice.
No, not unless you are confident that you are already good at painting. Cause you won't learn.
